divs: sighting detailsi entered i-4 from the debary exit, headed north, and almost immediately saw the object. it took me a second to realize that it wasn't a plane or helicopter, because i was watching the road. it was directly ahead of me (to the north). i started examining it closer, something about it just didn't seem right. i thought then that it might have been a firework, but after a few moments watching it decided it wasn't. it was moving too slowly to be a rocket, and glided left\right, towards me and away from me. perhaps not directly focused on me, but it did manage to stay in my view. i can't estimate it's elevation, but it didn't seem to be any higher than i've seen most helicopters. it did not have a tail. it was too dim to be a flare. it was a fiery orange color, like a sunset, and had a tight, but wavering corona. it had no hot white point, but was a fairly solid orange, maybe dipping into red at the fringes. i realized then, that i had never seen anything like it before, and that is likely what drew my attention to it. i was shocked to realize that i couldn't place the object or come up with a satisfactory explanation for it. i exited i-4 at the last exit for deland, tried to keep sight of it as the ramp made a circle, but lost sight of it for a second or two. when i had finished exiting i tried to reacquire it. it should have been easy to spot, there was plenty of open sky, but it had vanished. edit: after digesting the encounter, i didn't feel anything other than elation at my first sighting of something i couldn't identify. during the sighting, i had the distinct impression that i was seeing two objects. two identical spheres, but so close to each other that they appeared as one. again, there was only the impression of this, i can't claim to have seen two distinct objects.
trends: There have been 3 other sightings in DeLand
There were no other sightings in DeLand on or around December 31st 2009
